creator: MattAuSupport

content:
We know exactly what you tell us, nothing more. for us to investigate this issue, we will need some more information.

Could you please do the following?

  1. Open the menu > Help > Troubleshooting Information, then click Copy text to Clipboard.
  2. Go to https://pastebin.mozilla.org/, paste the clipboard by right clicking in the large text area, select paste from the menu, change the retention period to expire in 28 days, use the Paste Snippet button to create a page containing your info, then copy the resulting URL (address) of the page created.
  3. Open a reply to this post, and paste the URL to your troubleshooting information you just copied.
  4. Please also provide results for the following test on your system
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
    • Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi, Can you see if you are authenticating the SMTP server?

To check that: - Settings - Click on the e-mail address to open the account settings - Scroll down to the Outgoing Server (SMTP) - Click on edit - and from the window that appears ensure that the authentication method is with password or something more advanced.

Let me know if this helped.
creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Hi Indeed there were at least two add-ons for that in the past and I believe none of them is available. There is another option (not working on all OS), but this would require you to program your own notifications using the add-on here: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/scriptable-notifications/?src=ss.

Some examples are available here

There is nothing out of the box that works at the moment.

Have a nice day!
creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Hi Wanderer, I think the functionality to move multiple folders between account types do not exists in Thunderbird. Maybe you could request one.

Please note that the POP3 folders are stored locally, but IMAP folders are stored on your IMAP server and just displayed via Thunderbird. You have to move it one by one by selecting the folder and then with right "Move to" and selecting the new location.

Have a great day!
creator: shopov.bogomil

content: I have since located the offender, the webcal server.

content: It looks like the attachment column disappeared from the column view. You can get it back by right clicking the star (next to the X in your screenshot), and clicking on the "Attachments" option.
